name: Hotel Edouard VII

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is slightly outside of the main spots, but once you enter you know that this is a very pleasant quite place. People at the counter where friendly, the breakfast was very good although we were there outside of the main season. The whole athmosphere of the hotel is good and the lounge was very nice.
reviews.title: very charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on our first visit to Biarritz. It was a lovely surprise as it is a building that used to house the physician of Napolean. It is decorated with style and grace and has lovely appointments. Our room was decorated with taste and was appealing to the eye. The hotel serves breakfast, but not dinner. This is not a problem as it is only 300 meters to the beaches of the "Coast of the Basques" and the "Port Vieux" where there are numerous restaurants, cafes and bars. The views along the coastal path are stunning and Biarritz is alive with a genteel and vibrant atmophere. No parking, however it can be found close by.
reviews.title: "A great find!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff friendly and helpful as well. Would certainly return again. Biarritz is now a prime surfing destination as Deborah Kerr's husband introduced the sport in 1955.
reviews.title: Our first visit to Biarritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to the area and this hotel was just right for us; everything in the town within easy walking distance. The whole hotel was clean and beautifully decorated. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was a good size with a well appointed bathroom. Bath towels could be a little bigger. We would certainly go back again.
reviews.title: Such a pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very charming and well decorated and maintained hotel at a perfect location for town, beach and Les Halles where you will find all the excellent restaurants and tapas bars. Reception so friendly and helpful and multilingual. She even spoke Dutch. Lovely decorated and spacious rooms and bathroom. Very clean and good beds. Attractive terrace, where we had our delicious breakfast. It really can't get any better. Thank you so much Hotel Edouard VII!
reviews.title: A lovely stay in Biarritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Edouard VII ia a very nice, clean and convenient hotel to stay in Biarritz. The house is very pretty and the breakfast/living room (you can have breakfast in the adjacent terrace too in good weather) is very well decorated. The breakfast is interesting and, even it is 10 euros, it is worth the money (you can get the same things at more or less the same price outside the hotel but the experience is better in it).
reviews.title: Nice place and nice people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We stayed in a room in the basement, what at first sounds weird. Wrong! Ours had a nice terrace. and lots of light. The rooms are comfortable, not trendy or chic but nice.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel close to the center and, even it has no parking, they can advise you on streets without meters (that are not much in Biarritz)
reviews.title: A classy and comfortable place to stay in the heart of Biarritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Edouard VII is an excellent option in Biarritz
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but the family rooms in the basement are not that impressive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a wonderful French feel to it. Staff helpful & polite. Very clean, we had a standard room & so were delighted to have a balcony looking over the street (which is not too busy & second set of French doors block out the sound). Large bed, crisp cotton sheets, good sized bathroom & stripped wooden floors (hygienic in hotels). My only criticism of room is that the towels are very worn & not big enough & the mirror in the bedroom is too small & has a crackle effect so not suitable for make up etc. however big mirror in bathroom with hair dryer located on wall. Great air con (needed as 33 deg) & fridge with soft drinks. Breakfast served on a beautiful terrace, buffet style with fresh pastries, bread, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cheese & ham.
reviews.title: Great stay in very nice, quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOVED LOVED LOVED this hotel... if you want to a really uniquely french experience then this is the place to go. It's an old converted villa and is very small and charming and beautifully decorated. I especially loved the french doors and small balcony in our bedroom overlooking the quaint tree-lined street outside. Really enjoyed eating breakfast outside on the terrace even though the selection of food on offer wasn't the greatest I've ever seen.... just the typical continental selection..I loved the beautiful china on the tables though. The location is also fantastic as the town centre is just a 5 minute walk away and the beach about a 10 minute walk. There are great restaurants within a 5 minute radius of the hotel too. I would really recommend this hotel for friends/couples (not too elderly though as there's a steep hill to walk up to the hotel from the town) as I don't think you could really classify it as a family type hotel.
reviews.title: Charming old villa style hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent and charming hotel located in a very nice neighborhood close to the center and the beaches. The rooms are nicely decorated and very cosy. We booked one of their delux rooms, which had an amazing seaview as a bonus!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really liked this location. It was in a slightly quieter area of town up from a nice fruit/cheese/meat market. It was also only about 2 blocks from the outside restaurants in Halles street. Plus it was a pleasant 10 minutes walk to the more surfer beach (which was also great to swim in).
reviews.title: There seem 3 types of locations - we liked this plus beds for 4 people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We prefered this area to the hotels in the older grand hotel part of town. It was quieter and was less overtly touristy in terms of stores.
reviews.title: Beautiful 'French' Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walk from the hotel to almost anywhere you want to go in Biarritz would be less than 15-20 minutes as its in the center. The closest bus stop was about 2 long blocks away.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Edouard VII with my family and only have good things to say about this hotel. The large townhouse is well looked after and beautiful. Its classic interior is nicely decorated and has that certain french charm. I think it was renovated not long ago. It is wonderfully located (quiet neighbourhood), conveniently close to the beach and the Vieux Port (Harbor).
reviews.title: Top notch hotel in Biarritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff is very professional and attentive to one's needs. Breakfast is served on the ground floor, in the room overlooking the sunny terrace. Great way to start the day.
reviews.title: very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well priced for a 3* hotel.
reviews.title: Price, Location, Service + History

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well located in a quiet but central location, very clean rooms, and attractive building and decor. The front desk made an excellent dinner suggestion (Ospi) and our rooms on the top floor were quiet. The bed could have been a bit firmer and the bathtub/shower has an uneven bottom which is kind of odd for showering, but otherwise no complaints and would definitely come back as you do get value for money here.
reviews.title: Perfectly located to enjoy all the benefits of Biarritz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just finished a 2 night stay at this Hotel which we arrived at by chance. The staff were very helpful, pointed us to some great restaurants and spoke any language we tried,..lol
reviews.title: Nice charming hotel

description: Within a 5 minutes walk from the beach, this hotel is one of the few place whitch has kept its charm of the past.Our 18 rooms are equipped with baths, toilets, direct phone, free access wifi, TV, individual safe, mini-bar and air-conditioning.
